intro: Casinga suaveolens, commonly known as the sweet-scented casinga, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically ovate and covered in a fine, soft pubescence. Casinga suaveolens is often cultivated for its ornamental value and pleasant fragrance.
